alert.note: Alert for Elliott; Johnson; Magoffin; Morgan; Wolfe (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 7:19PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Morgan, Johnson, northwestern Breathitt, northern Magoffin, eastern Wolfe and southeastern Elliott Counties through 800 PM EDT... At 717 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lykins, or 9 miles south of West Liberty, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Wonnie, Bloomington, Matthew, Elsie, Gifford and Cottle around 725 PM EDT. Salyersville, Orient, Logville, Cisco, Haleburg, Plutarch, Tella, Coon, Florress and Licksburg around 730 PM EDT. Silverhill, Grayfox, Ever, Dingus, Lacey, Quod, Minefork, Flat Fork, Jeptha and Wheelersburg around 735 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Ophir, Mima, Relief, Win, Moon, Hargis, Crockett, Redbush, Gillem Branch, Elna, Keaton, Barnrock, Flatgap, Winifred, Kerz, Sip, Galen and Chandlerville. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Bert T. Combs Mountain Parkway between mile markers 52 and 76. U.S. Highway 23 in Johnson County between mile markers 5 and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
